subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Chicago Cubs outfielder Milton Bradley has been suspended for two games and fined an undisclosed amount after he “aggressively argued balls and strikes and made contact with umpire Larry Vanover,” during the Cubs’ 7-4 loss to the St. Louis Cardinals on Thursday, Bob Watson, baseball’s vice president for on-field operations, said in a statement.
